title: ChiBitCTy
author: ChiBitCTy
content: I don’t really know how to describe these things, but they call them bricks, and they are sort of a way to store & hide coins and paper notes. Check these two massive bitcoin coins out..Here is the instagram link, will check and see if there’s one up on YouTube here in a bit - https://www.instagram.com/reel/CscZNt_sbNv/?igshid=NzJjY2FjNWJiZg==Here’s the company website - https://www.gorillaprocustoms.com/?fbclid=PAAaaRhcmdwVCRtOlCU3xUY59LY65Tk4yWtRnVHXXxcQJpXD0G6pQxGl2cOhs

comments.author: Bullion-n-BTC
comments.body: These are cool but for the price they sell them for I think is crazy

comments.author: MoparMiningLLC
comments.body: Could not find it on their site

comments.author: Kryptowerk
comments.body: Quote from: MoparMiningLLC on May 20, 2023, 03:55:59 AMCould not find it on their siteSame, I checked some of their bricks, but the Bitcoin-themed one didn't pop up so far.Their pricing seems through the roof. But maybe it's just because we are used to industrialized products, looks like they do a lot of manual finishing on their products.Still... paying $1k to store away 10k appears kind of strange to me.Anyhow, cool massive Bitcoin brick in their video for sure.

I somehow came across these guys and their products a few weeks ago. I think it was on either instagram or YouTube and the algorithm had it pop up for me. What I had noticed was they used a lot of those basic 1oz fine silver bitcoin coins, so that caught my eye. Then this post popped up on my timeline yesterday. I agree with you guys, very cool but pricey, not sure I can justify it. Would love to have one though.

comments.body: It would be pretty sweet if those were made out of silver. That would be an epic piece. Would make my 10oz silver coins look tiny in comparison. I wonder if they would be willing to do a custom silver version. Might have to reach out and get a price for shits and giggles. A gigantic silver minted seat replica would make me happy but I wouldn’t know how to keep this thing from tarnishing. Probably why they don’t use silver.

comments.author: OgNasty
comments.body: Quote from: Mitchell on May 21, 2023, 02:03:13 PMOf all the designs to use, why would they use that one? I know it was originally designed by MJB, but it has been completely ruined. Just the amount of shitty AliExpress "coins" I've seen with that specific design makes it instantly undesirable.Everyone always rips off Mick's design.  It's pretty incredible how he managed to create something that is still being ripped off more than a decade later.  I'm guilty of it too to some extent (I actually paid Mick 'MJB' to create the designs for my Binary rounds as well as my Bitpics).  Whenever I see a creator here use his images though I always try and encourage them to at least send Mick a free one since I doubt they'd consider royalties.  This is something I'd like to see more of from this community.  We should be standing up for creators like Mick instead of buying their designs from creators that simply rip them off.
